actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 476 (Sen. Blumenthal):
        A resolution supporting the goals and ideals of a National Move Over Law Day.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 477 (Sen. Hyde-Smith):
        A resolution commending the University of Mississippi for 175 years of service to the State of Mississippi and the United States.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 478 (Sen. Rosen):
        A resolution designating November 2023 as "National Hospice and Palliative Care Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN157:
        Jose Javier Rodriguez, of Florida, to be an Assistant Secretary of Labor

        -- Cloture not invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 51. Record Vote Number: 318 


        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to reconsider the vote (Roll Call Vote No. 318) by which cloture was not invoked on the nomination entered in Senate.


 PN817:
        Margaret M. Garnett, of New York, to be United States District Judge for the Southern District of New York

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 46. Record Vote Number: 316 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 46. Record Vote Number: 317 



 PN903:
        Jeffrey M. Bryan, of Minnesota, to be United States District Judge for the District of Minnesota

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 46. Record Vote Number: 315 



 PN1022:
        Micah W.J. Smith, of Hawaii, to be United States District Judge for the District of Hawaii

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of nomination made in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate 11/29/2023.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Durbin, at  5:46 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
